intro: Clitandropsis novoguineensis, commonly known as the Guinean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and palmately lobed leaves. Clitandropsis novoguineensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
